factoid: Tíkhon knew that his master sometimes thinks aloud.
Tíkhon met the face that emerged from the shirt with an angrily inquisitive expression.
The old prince asked if she had gone to bed.
Like all good valets, Tíkhon instinctively knew the direction of his master’s thoughts.
Tíkhon guessed that the old prince’s question referred to Prince Vasíli and Prince Vasíli’s son.
The old prince said that Prince Vasíli and Prince Vasíli’s son have gone to bed and put out their lights.
The old prince said that no good was good.
The old prince thrust his feet into his slippers.
The old prince thrust his arms into the sleeves of his dressing gown.
The old prince went to the couch on which he slept.
No words had passed between Anatole and Mademoiselle Bourienne.
Anatole and Mademoiselle Bourienne understood each other regarding the first part of their romance up to the appearance of the pauvre mère.
Anatole and Mademoiselle Bourienne understood that they had much to say to one another in private.
Anatole and Mademoiselle Bourienne had been seeking an opportunity since morning to meet one another alone.
Princess Mary went to her father’s room at the usual hour.
Mademoiselle Bourienne and Anatole met in the conservatory.
Princess Mary went to the door of the study with special trepidation.
Princess Mary felt that everybody knew that her fate would be decided that day.
Princess Mary felt that everybody knew what she thought about her fate.
Princess Mary read this in Tíkhon’s face.
Princess Mary read this in Prince Vasíli’s valet’s face.
Prince Vasíli’s valet made Princess Mary a low bow when she met him in the corridor carrying hot water.
The old prince was very affectionate and careful in his treatment of Princess Mary that morning.
Princess Mary well knew the painstaking expression of the old prince’s face.
The old prince’s face wore that expression when his dry hands clenched with vexation at Princess Mary’s not understanding a sum in arithmetic.
The old prince walked away from Princess Mary when he rose from his chair.
The old prince repeated the same words several times in a low voice.
The old prince came to the point at once.
The old prince treated Princess Mary ceremoniously.
The old prince said that he had had a proposition made to him concerning Princess Mary.
The old prince expected that Princess Mary had guessed that Prince Vasíli had not come and had not brought his pupil with him.
The old prince referred to Anatole as a pupil.
The old prince said that a proposition was made to him last night on Princess Mary’s account.
The old prince referred the proposition to Princess Mary.
Princess Mary asked the old prince how she was to understand him.
Princess Mary grew pale and then blushed.
The old prince angrily cried that he was not understood.
The old prince said that Prince Vasíli finds Princess Mary to his taste as a daughter-in-law.
The old prince said that Prince Vasíli makes a proposal to Princess Mary on his pupil’s behalf.
The old prince said that this is how it is to be understood.
Princess Mary whispered that she did not know what the old prince thought.
Princess Mary said that she was not going to get married.
Princess Mary asked her father what about him.
Princess Mary saw that the old prince regarded the matter with disapproval.
Princess Mary thought that her fate would be decided now or never.
Princess Mary lowered her eyes so as not to see the gaze.
Princess Mary said that she wished only to do the old prince’s will, but if she had to express her own desire.
The old prince interrupted Princess Mary.
The old prince shouted that that was admirable.
The old prince said that he will take Princess Mary with her dowry and take Mademoiselle Bourienne into the bargain.
The old prince said that Mademoiselle Bourienne will be the wife, while Princess Mary will be something unspecified.
The old prince stopped.
The old prince saw the effect these words had produced on Princess Mary.
Princess Mary lowered her head.
Princess Mary was ready to burst into tears.
The old prince said that he was only joking.
The old prince said that he holds to the principle that a maiden has a full right to choose.
The old prince gave Princess Mary freedom.
The old prince said that Princess Mary’s life’s happiness depends on her decision.
The old prince said that he was not to be minded.
Princess Mary said that she did not know the old prince.
